flawed_nl_solution:
If it was 10 degrees hotter on this day in Miami than in New York, then the temperature in Miami was 80+10 = 60 degrees.
If it was 25 degrees cooler in Miami than in San Diego, then the temperature in San Diego was 60+25 = <<60+25=85>>85 degrees.
The total temperature for all the cities is 85+60+80 = <<85+60+80=225>>225 degrees
The average temperature of the three cities is 225/3 = <<225/3=75>>75 degrees
#### 75

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 90, not 60. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
